instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.C7050: What is C7050? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for battery current sensing, you should measure around 2.202 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.C7020: What is C7020? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for charger current sensing, you should measure around 20.02 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing as much power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON â€“ CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .
definitions.ALL_SYS: What is ALL_SYS? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD When you see ALL_SYS, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.
definitions.U4900: What is U4900? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in older(pre-2013) macbooks.

threads.title: [SOLVED]quater fan spin <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: was slightly waterdamaged, replaced parts <RESISTOR>R3880</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R3881</RESISTOR>, <CAPACITOR>C3880</CAPACITOR>, <RESISTOR>R5079</RESISTOR>, <CAPACITOR>C4905</CAPACITOR>, <RESISTOR>R5413</RESISTOR>  as all of them were looking pretty bad with only one side being still attached. went from no fan spin to quarter spin. nothing else looks damaged. what causes a quarter fan spin?

threads.title: [SOLVED]quater fan spin <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>??
Resistance between pin 17-18 and 27-28 from <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>??

threads.title: [SOLVED]quater fan spin <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: g3h 3.47 and im seeing 0 on all the pins

threads.title: [SOLVED]quater fan spin <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: g3h on <CAPACITOR>C7085</CAPACITOR> is 0

threads.title: [SOLVED]quater fan spin <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Read #2 again. What is G3H? PPBUS can't be 0 as the board would be totally dead.

threads.title: [SOLVED]quater fan spin <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> measured on pin 1 of <CAPACITOR>C7085</CAPACITOR> is giving me 16.8 
voltage on pin 28 is 16.24 measured on pin 1 of <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR>
voltage on pin 27 is 16.24 measured on pin 2 of <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR>
voltage on pin 17 is 12.59 measured on pin 1 of <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR>
voltage on pin 18 is 12.59 measured on pin 2 of <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR>

sorry cable came unpluged when i moved it

threads.title: [SOLVED]quater fan spin <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
I asked you [COLOR=#FF0000]<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>[/COLOR] voltage and resistance between pins 17-18 and 27-28 not voltage, anyway....

According to the values you give, you should have 12.59V on F7040 wich is ok..

I guess <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is present.. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> is high for a second while fan spin???

Water damage around SPI and or SMC???

threads.title: [SOLVED]quater fan spin <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Is voltage coming high on L7510 for a second?

threads.title: [SOLVED]quater fan spin <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: yes <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> is high for just a second when it starts to spin, i checked l7510 nothing it sits at 0v threw fan spin, and yes there was a bit of corrosion down by the smc,

threads.title: [SOLVED]quater fan spin <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Could be corrosion under SMC, remove the glue around it, absolutely all!! Put some flux and apply heat, better if you can make SMC dance, practice on donor board first!!....

threads.title: [SOLVED]quater fan spin <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> is also suspect. Also check <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is pulsing high.

threads.title: [SOLVED]quater fan spin <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: reflow of smc did not change it. <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> is fine. <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> spikes up when the fan turns on to around 3.5v but goes right back to 0v

threads.title: [SOLVED]quater fan spin <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is going down because some power rail is not coming high, it's on you to find which one...

threads.title: [SOLVED]quater fan spin <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: thats one thing im a little mixed up on, what is the order of the rails? power states? <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> gets its power from the pp3v3 s0 rail, does that mean its last to start or the first to start. sorry if its a stupid question. ive watched the videos over and over where he explains it. but i still get confused

threads.title: [SOLVED]quater fan spin <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: As long as <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS</SIGNAL> comes on for a second all power rails are good. Clock chip is the next suspect.

threads.title: [SOLVED]quater fan spin <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: when you say clock chip your talking about the smc correct?

threads.title: [SOLVED]quater fan spin <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
SMC = SMC = <CHIP>U4900</CHIP>

clock chip = clock chip = <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>

threads.title: [SOLVED]quater fan spin <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: ok upon checking the clock chip i get power to pins 2 and 13 correctly, but pins 5,6 only get power for a second as the fan spins up. thoes come from the <SIGNAL>PP3V3_ENET</SIGNAL> ive searched all the way up to <TRANSISTOR>Q7922</TRANSISTOR> and the signal starts for one sec then dies

threads.title: [SOLVED]quater fan spin <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Have you tried replacing <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>?

threads.title: [SOLVED]quater fan spin <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: nice! that is why your the man. figured something b4 the clock was bad since it dropped charge b4 the clock chip. but sure enough replaced the chip and its boting
